sec.p: A recent study (LIPOGAIN) [ 36, 37] conducted on young, healthy, average-weight and slightly overweight subjects (Body mass index (BMI) 18–27 kg/m²) highlights that the consumption of desserts prepared with palm oil causes a more atherogenic lipoprotein profile, a doubling of visceral fat and a significant increase of hepatic steatosis compared with the use of sunflower oil.

Such effects are probably connected with the consumption of fatty acids in general and not palm oil in particular, as similar results were observed with the use of butter in the place of palm oil [ 38]. However, definitive data in this regard do not exist in the literature [ 39].
